corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

sentence.text: ` It 's brilliant to get things out in the open .
` It was brilliant to hit the goals that took us to the top , and it 's got to be the best 90 minutes of my career . "
But he 's brilliant at old ladies , bright old ladies with shining eyes . "
She was respected by everyone she worked with and was brilliant at the job .
All the prize guys who were brilliant at football had disappeared and I was left with the swots . "
Their mentor was brilliant at his job .
Playing the piano is something I love and I want to be brilliant at it . "
That dreadful Charles would be brilliant at the job .
When he was not in an impatient mood , Blanche knew Dexter was brilliant at this sort of interrogation , conducting it with great sensitivity .
Barney was a super person and brilliant at his scientist job , but otherwise a trifle absent-minded and generally helpless .
She was brilliant at the job and had a great future . "
My father , brilliant at stripping cars and putting them back together , encouraged my interest in dismantling bicycles , old radios , antique clocks .
She was brilliant in court .
` Bloody good , that 's brilliant of Rupert .
` Gazza has always been brilliant on the football field and it will be great to see him back after the long haul he 's had . "
Someone who 's brilliant on the cinema screen is n't necessarily a good talk show guest .
She might not be good with words but she was brilliant at thinking in pictures .
Having a fat youth in your crew , whose shoulders were way above his head and who was brilliant at bristling .
` He did n't score many goals but he was brilliant at laying on the ball for others .
Younger cats are not only good at hearing high-pitched squeaks , they are also brilliant at detecting precise direction .
Owners of deaf white cats report that their pets are brilliant at compensating for their genetic disability .
He was brilliant at handling the most difficult client .
The fruit of some brilliant opening analysis .
A brilliant 30-metre solo try by Allan Bateman and two tries from John Devereux and Rob Ackerman saw Wales roar into an 18-4 lead .
They forget that Picasso was a brilliant draughtsman , composer , colourist .
After being tripped by Terry Hurlock , Andy Sinton got up to curl a brilliant 25-yard free kick round the wall .
Scientists and science educators might do well to worry about the attractiveness of computers and the sense of power they unlock for brilliant young people today .
However , Hanks 's ` Singin' In The Rain " routine is brilliant .
His response on that occasion was brilliant , both in planning and execution .
He had to be brilliant , she thought , to be so well up in his profession at his age .
In the pairs Ronnie Oliver and Ian McClure had a 21-14 win over Emmet Downey and Gary Rutledge in a match which saw the brilliant McClure on the top of his form .
` Our defence was brilliant and hopefully we can be as professional in the future . "
If he were brilliant , he probably would not be a family doctor in the first place .
